info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 9:29AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Snow band will impact portions of west central Crowley and central Pueblo Counties through 1000 AM MDT... At 923 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a snow band along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Boone to near Avondale to near Pueblo Reservoir. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of moderate to heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to around one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Pueblo, Boone, Pueblo Reservoir and Salt Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
